titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Tibor Flórián papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Martina Podsklanova

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-07-24T08:44-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Revised to note that boxes 97-109 are closed pending preservation treatment.
Revised to add notes on audio reels.
Revised to add offsite storage note.
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.

did.abstract: Correspondence, transcripts and sound recordings of radio broadcasts, poems and other writings, memoranda, reports, printed matter, and memorabilia relating to Radio Free Europe broadcasts to Hungary, the Hungarian Revolution of 1956, Hungarian émigré affairs, Hungarian-language publishing in the United States, and international freedom for writers issues.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 97-109 are closed; remainder of collection is open for research. Collection stored off site; a minimum of two days notice is required for use. Boxes may be requested through Stanford's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu

Use copies of some sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Tibor Flórián papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2006.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Hungarian subject collection, Hoover Institution Archives
RFE/RL broadcast records, Hoover Institution Archives
RFE/RL corporate records, Hoover Institution Archives

chronitem.event: Born, Selmecbánya, Austro-Hungary (present-day Banská Štiavnica, Slovakia)
Graduated, Roman Catholic Lyceum, Cluj (in Hungarian: Kolozsvár), Romania
Graduated, University of Cluj, law degree
Active member of Hungarian literary circles in Cluj; probably resided and worked for most of this time in Gherla (in Hungarian: Szamosújvár), Romania
Author, Felhők fölött, felhők alatt, a book of poetry
Author, Vázlatok, a book of poetry
Immigrated to Germany
Resided in the town of Cham
Married to Áva Felföldy

Literary editor of the émigré weekly Hungaria; at some point an employee of the American Red Cross; a member of émigré organizations and a contributor to émigré periodicals, from this time on and throughout his life
Author, Kőtáblák öszetörtek, a book of poetry
Author, Mélység fölött, a book of poetry
Immigrated to the United States
Resided in New Jersey and Connecticut
Announcer and later Editor, Radio Free Europe, New York City, N.Y.
Board Member of Kossuth Publishing Co. (Kossuth Kiadó), New York City and Cleveland, Ohio
Married Sophie Weress
Board Member, mostly Treasurer, of American Branch of International P.E.N.: Writers in Exile, New York City
Member and Board Member of Arpad Academy (Árpád Akadémia), Cleveland
Member and Board Member of American Transylvanian Federation (Amerikai Erdélyi Szövetség), New York City
Author, Keserű gyökéren, a book of poetry
Died, Punta Gorda, Florida

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Tibor Flórián papers document Hungarian-American cultural and political activities, including responses to the 1956 Hungarian Revolution and activities on behalf of the Hungarian community in Transylvania, as well as Hungarian-language publishing in the United States, and international freedom for writers issues. Materials include correspondence with Hungarian émigrés, especially writers and journalists, mostly in the United States, South America, Germany and Australia; transcripts, sound recordings, and other materials of the Radio Free Europe Hungarian service; and Flórián's poetry, essays, and other writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains mostly correspondence with other writers and with editors of Hungarian periodicals, writings and related materials. Arranged alphabetically and then chronologically.

did.unittitle: Hungarian cultural and political activities file,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Covers mainly activities of those organizations which Flórián belonged to or had contacts with, mainly in the United States: the American Transylvanian Federation (Amerikai Erdélyi Szövetség), Arpad Academy (Árpád Akadémia), Magyar Piarista Diákszövetség (Hungarian Piarist Alumni Association), Magyar Szabadságharcos Szövetség (Hungarian Freedom Fighters Federation) and others, and contains correspondence, promotional materials and related matter, arranged generally in original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, internal documents, and other materials related to the publishing of Hungarian-language publications, arranged generally in original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, transcripts of programs, promotional materials and related matter, arranged generally in original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Poetry, prose writings, presentation and lecture materials, essays, published articles, translations of Flórián's poetry and of miscellaneous other writings, musical scores, and notes, as well as related correspondence and other materials, arranged generally in original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Labels, when present, indicate materials for Radio Free Europe programs (especially the Musical Messages) and folk music recordings. Includes 188 sound reels, arranged generally in original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The first recording on the tape is a woman singing with piano accompaniment. The second and third recordings are a man speaking dramatically.

did.unittitle: Fairy tales performed as folk songs,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A folk singer narrates and sings renditions of Rumpelstiltskin, the Three Bears, and Cinderella. In English.

did.unittitle: The rest of the sound recordings are not yet described

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Associatio Alumnorum Scholarum Piarum Hungariae, Zrínyi Miklós Literary Circle, Árpád Academy, Magyar Kongresszus, Two Thousand Men of Achievement, International PEN, American Biographical Institute, and others.
